trans-unit.source: How to implement disaster recovery using service backup and restore in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: How to implement disaster recovery using service backup and restore in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use backup and restore to perform disaster recovery in Azure API Management.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use backup and restore to perform disaster recovery in Azure API Management.

trans-unit.source: How to implement disaster recovery using service backup and restore in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: How to implement disaster recovery using service backup and restore in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: By choosing to publish and manage your APIs via Azure API Management you are taking advantage of many fault tolerance and infrastructure capabilities that you would otherwise have to design, implement, and manage.
trans-unit.target: By choosing to publish and manage your APIs via Azure API Management you are taking advantage of many fault tolerance and infrastructure capabilities that you would otherwise have to design, implement, and manage.

trans-unit.source: The Azure platform mitigates a large fraction of potential failures at a fraction of the cost.
trans-unit.target: The Azure platform mitigates a large fraction of potential failures at a fraction of the cost.

trans-unit.source: To recover from availability problems affecting the region where your API Management service is hosted you should be ready to reconstitute your service in a different region at any time.
trans-unit.target: To recover from availability problems affecting the region where your API Management service is hosted you should be ready to reconstitute your service in a different region at any time.

trans-unit.source: Depending on your availability goals and recovery time objective you might want to reserve a backup service in one or more regions and try to maintain their configuration and content in sync with the active service.
trans-unit.target: Depending on your availability goals and recovery time objective you might want to reserve a backup service in one or more regions and try to maintain their configuration and content in sync with the active service.

trans-unit.source: The service backup and restore feature provides the necessary building block for implementing your disaster recovery strategy.
trans-unit.target: The service backup and restore feature provides the necessary building block for implementing your disaster recovery strategy.

trans-unit.source: This guide shows how to authenticate Azure Resource Manager requests, and how to backup and restore your API Management service instances.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows how to authenticate Azure Resource Manager requests, and how to backup and restore your API Management service instances.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The process for backing up and restoring an API Management service instance for disaster recovery can also be used for replicating API Management service instances for scenarios such as staging.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The process for backing up and restoring an API Management service instance for disaster recovery can also be used for replicating API Management service instances for scenarios such as staging.

trans-unit.source: Authenticating Azure Resource Manager requests
trans-unit.target: Authenticating Azure Resource Manager requests

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The REST API for backup and restore uses Azure Resource Manager and has a different authentication mechanism than the REST APIs for managing your API Management entities.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The REST API for backup and restore uses Azure Resource Manager and has a different authentication mechanism than the REST APIs for managing your API Management entities.

trans-unit.source: The steps in this section describe how to authenticate Azure Resource Manager requests.
trans-unit.target: The steps in this section describe how to authenticate Azure Resource Manager requests.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Authenticating Azure Resource Manager requests](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn790557.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Authenticating Azure Resource Manager requests](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn790557.aspx).

trans-unit.source: All of the tasks that you do on resources using the Azure Resource Manager must be authenticated with Azure Active Directory using the following steps.
trans-unit.target: All of the tasks that you do on resources using the Azure Resource Manager must be authenticated with Azure Active Directory using the following steps.

trans-unit.source: Add an application to the Azure Active Directory tenant.
trans-unit.target: Add an application to the Azure Active Directory tenant.

trans-unit.source: Set permissions for the application that you added.
trans-unit.target: Set permissions for the application that you added.

trans-unit.source: Get the token for authenticating requests to Azure Resource Manager.
trans-unit.target: Get the token for authenticating requests to Azure Resource Manager.

trans-unit.source: The first step is to create an Azure Active Directory application.
trans-unit.target: The first step is to create an Azure Active Directory application.

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Management portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com/) using the subscription that contains your API Management service instance and navigate to the **Applications** tab for your default Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Management portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com/) using the subscription that contains your API Management service instance and navigate to the **Applications** tab for your default Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If the Azure Active Directory default directory is not visible to your account, contact the administrator of the Azure subscription to grant the required permissions to your account.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If the Azure Active Directory default directory is not visible to your account, contact the administrator of the Azure subscription to grant the required permissions to your account.

trans-unit.source: For information on locating your default directory, see [Locate your default directory in the Azure Portal](../virtual-machines/resource-group-create-work-id-from-persona.md/#locate-your-default-directory-in-the-azure-portal).
trans-unit.target: For information on locating your default directory, see [Locate your default directory in the Azure Portal](../virtual-machines/resource-group-create-work-id-from-persona.md/#locate-your-default-directory-in-the-azure-portal).

trans-unit.source: Create Azure Active Directory application
trans-unit.target: Create Azure Active Directory application

trans-unit.source: Click **Add**, **Add an application my organization is developing**, and choose **Native client application**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add**, **Add an application my organization is developing**, and choose **Native client application**.

trans-unit.source: Enter a descriptive name, and click the next arrow.
trans-unit.target: Enter a descriptive name, and click the next arrow.

trans-unit.source: Enter a placeholder URL such as `http://resources` for the **Redirect URI**, as it is a required field, but the value is not used later.
trans-unit.target: Enter a placeholder URL such as `http://resources` for the **Redirect URI**, as it is a required field, but the value is not used later.

trans-unit.source: Click the check box to save the application.
trans-unit.target: Click the check box to save the application.

trans-unit.source: Once the application is saved, click **Configure**, scroll down to the **permissions to other applications** section, and click **Add application**.
trans-unit.target: Once the application is saved, click **Configure**, scroll down to the **permissions to other applications** section, and click **Add application**.

trans-unit.source: Add permissions
trans-unit.target: Add permissions

trans-unit.source: Select **Windows** **Azure Service Management API** and click the checkbox to add the application.
trans-unit.target: Select **Windows** **Azure Service Management API** and click the checkbox to add the application.

trans-unit.source: Add permissions
trans-unit.target: Add permissions

trans-unit.source: Click **Delegated Permissions** beside the newly added **Windows** **Azure Service Management API** application, check the box for **Access Azure Service Management (preview)**, and click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Delegated Permissions** beside the newly added **Windows** **Azure Service Management API** application, check the box for **Access Azure Service Management (preview)**, and click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Add permissions
trans-unit.target: Add permissions

trans-unit.source: Prior to invoking the APIs that generate the backup and restore it, it is necessary to get a token.
trans-unit.target: Prior to invoking the APIs that generate the backup and restore it, it is necessary to get a token.

trans-unit.source: The following example uses the [Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory) nuget package to retrieve the token.
trans-unit.target: The following example uses the [Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory) nuget package to retrieve the token.

trans-unit.source: Replace `{tentand id}`, `{application id}`, and `{redirect uri}` using the following instructions.
trans-unit.target: Replace `{tentand id}`, `{application id}`, and `{redirect uri}` using the following instructions.

trans-unit.source: Replace `{tenant id}` with the tenant id of the Azure Active Directory application you just created.
trans-unit.target: Replace `{tenant id}` with the tenant id of the Azure Active Directory application you just created.

trans-unit.source: You can access the id by clicking **View endpoints**.
trans-unit.target: You can access the id by clicking **View endpoints**.

trans-unit.source: Endpoints
trans-unit.target: Endpoints

trans-unit.source: Endpoints
trans-unit.target: Endpoints

trans-unit.source: Replace `{application id}` and `{redirect uri}` using the **Client Id** and the URL from the **Redirect Uris** section from your Azure Active Directory application's **Configure** tab.
trans-unit.target: Replace `{application id}` and `{redirect uri}` using the **Client Id** and the URL from the **Redirect Uris** section from your Azure Active Directory application's **Configure** tab.

trans-unit.source: Resources
trans-unit.target: Resources

trans-unit.source: Once the values are specified, the code example should return a token similar to the following example.
trans-unit.target: Once the values are specified, the code example should return a token similar to the following example.

trans-unit.source: Token
trans-unit.target: Token

trans-unit.source: Before calling the backup and restore operations described in the following sections, set the authorization request header for your REST call.
trans-unit.target: Before calling the backup and restore operations described in the following sections, set the authorization request header for your REST call.

trans-unit.source: Backup an API Management service
trans-unit.target: Backup an API Management service

trans-unit.source: To backup an API Management service issue the following HTTP request:
trans-unit.target: To backup an API Management service issue the following HTTP request:

trans-unit.source: where:
trans-unit.target: where:

trans-unit.source: `subscriptionId` - id of the subscription containing the API Management service you are attempting to backup
trans-unit.target: `subscriptionId` - id of the subscription containing the API Management service you are attempting to backup

trans-unit.source: `resourceGroupName` - a string in the form of 'Api-Default-{service-region}' where `service-region` identifies the Azure region where the API Management service you are trying to backup is hosted, e.g. `North-Central-US`
trans-unit.target: `resourceGroupName` - a string in the form of 'Api-Default-{service-region}' where `service-region` identifies the Azure region where the API Management service you are trying to backup is hosted, e.g. `North-Central-US`

trans-unit.source: `serviceName` - the name of the API Management service you are making a backup of specified at the time of its creation
trans-unit.target: `serviceName` - the name of the API Management service you are making a backup of specified at the time of its creation

trans-unit.source: `api-version` - replace with `2014-02-14`
trans-unit.target: `api-version` - replace with `2014-02-14`

trans-unit.source: In the body of the request, specify the target Azure storage account name, access key, blob container name, and backup name:
trans-unit.target: In the body of the request, specify the target Azure storage account name, access key, blob container name, and backup name:

trans-unit.source: Set the value of the `Content-Type` request header to `application/json`.
trans-unit.target: Set the value of the `Content-Type` request header to `application/json`.

trans-unit.source: Backup is a long running operation that may take multiple minutes to complete.
trans-unit.target: Backup is a long running operation that may take multiple minutes to complete.

trans-unit.source: If the request was successful and the backup process was initiated you’ll receive a `202 Accepted` response status code with a `Location` header.
trans-unit.target: If the request was successful and the backup process was initiated you’ll receive a `202 Accepted` response status code with a `Location` header.

trans-unit.source: Make 'GET' requests to the URL in the `Location` header to find out the status of the operation.
trans-unit.target: Make 'GET' requests to the URL in the `Location` header to find out the status of the operation.

trans-unit.source: While the backup is in progress you will continue to receive a '202 Accepted' status code.
trans-unit.target: While the backup is in progress you will continue to receive a '202 Accepted' status code.

trans-unit.source: A Response code of `200 OK` will indicate successful completion of the backup operation.
trans-unit.target: A Response code of `200 OK` will indicate successful completion of the backup operation.

trans-unit.source: **Note**:
trans-unit.target: **Note**:

trans-unit.source: **Container** specified in the request body **must exist**.
trans-unit.target: **Container** specified in the request body **must exist**.

trans-unit.source: While backup is in progress you **should not attempt any service management operations** such as SKU upgrade or downgrade, domain name change, etc.
trans-unit.target: While backup is in progress you **should not attempt any service management operations** such as SKU upgrade or downgrade, domain name change, etc.

trans-unit.source: Restore of a **backup is guaranteed only for 7 days** since the moment of its creation.
trans-unit.target: Restore of a **backup is guaranteed only for 7 days** since the moment of its creation.

trans-unit.source: **Usage data** used for creating analytics reports **is not included** in the backup.
trans-unit.target: **Usage data** used for creating analytics reports **is not included** in the backup.

trans-unit.source: Use [Azure API Management REST API][] to periodically retrieve analytics reports for safekeeping.
trans-unit.target: Use [Azure API Management REST API][] to periodically retrieve analytics reports for safekeeping.

trans-unit.source: The frequency with which you perform service backups will affect your recovery point objective.
trans-unit.target: The frequency with which you perform service backups will affect your recovery point objective.

trans-unit.source: To minimize it we advise implementing regular backups as well as performing on-demand backups after making important changes to your API Management service.
trans-unit.target: To minimize it we advise implementing regular backups as well as performing on-demand backups after making important changes to your API Management service.

trans-unit.source: **Changes** made to the service configuration (e.g. APIs, policies, developer portal appearance) while backup operation is in process **might not be included in the backup and therefore will be lost**.
trans-unit.target: **Changes** made to the service configuration (e.g. APIs, policies, developer portal appearance) while backup operation is in process **might not be included in the backup and therefore will be lost**.

trans-unit.source: Restore an API Management service
trans-unit.target: Restore an API Management service

trans-unit.source: To restore an API Management service from a previously created backup make the following HTTP request:
trans-unit.target: To restore an API Management service from a previously created backup make the following HTTP request:

trans-unit.source: where:
trans-unit.target: where:

trans-unit.source: `subscriptionId` - id of the subscription containing the API Management service you are restoring a backup into
trans-unit.target: `subscriptionId` - id of the subscription containing the API Management service you are restoring a backup into

trans-unit.source: `resourceGroupName` - a string in the form of 'Api-Default-{service-region}' where `service-region` identifies the Azure region where the API Management service you are restoring a backup into is hosted, e.g. `North-Central-US`
trans-unit.target: `resourceGroupName` - a string in the form of 'Api-Default-{service-region}' where `service-region` identifies the Azure region where the API Management service you are restoring a backup into is hosted, e.g. `North-Central-US`

trans-unit.source: `serviceName` - the name of the API Management service being restored into specified at the time of its creation
trans-unit.target: `serviceName` - the name of the API Management service being restored into specified at the time of its creation

trans-unit.source: `api-version` - replace with `2014-02-14`
trans-unit.target: `api-version` - replace with `2014-02-14`

trans-unit.source: In the body of the request, specify the backup file location, i.e. Azure storage account name, access key, blob container name, and backup name:
trans-unit.target: In the body of the request, specify the backup file location, i.e. Azure storage account name, access key, blob container name, and backup name:

trans-unit.source: Set the value of the `Content-Type` request header to `application/json`.
trans-unit.target: Set the value of the `Content-Type` request header to `application/json`.

trans-unit.source: Restore is a long running operation that may take up to 30 or more minutes to complete.
trans-unit.target: Restore is a long running operation that may take up to 30 or more minutes to complete.

trans-unit.source: If the request was successful and the restore process was initiated you’ll receive a `202 Accepted` response status code with a `Location` header.
trans-unit.target: If the request was successful and the restore process was initiated you’ll receive a `202 Accepted` response status code with a `Location` header.

trans-unit.source: Make 'GET' requests to the URL in the `Location` header to find out the status of the operation.
trans-unit.target: Make 'GET' requests to the URL in the `Location` header to find out the status of the operation.

trans-unit.source: While the restore is in progress you will continue to receive '202 Accepted' status code.
trans-unit.target: While the restore is in progress you will continue to receive '202 Accepted' status code.

trans-unit.source: A response code of `200 OK` will indicate successful completion of the restore operation.
trans-unit.target: A response code of `200 OK` will indicate successful completion of the restore operation.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] **The SKU** of the service being restored into **must match** the SKU of the backed up service being restored.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] **The SKU** of the service being restored into **must match** the SKU of the backed up service being restored.

trans-unit.source: **Changes** made to the service configuration (e.g. APIs, policies, developer portal appearance) while restore operation is in progress **could be overwritten**.
trans-unit.target: **Changes** made to the service configuration (e.g. APIs, policies, developer portal appearance) while restore operation is in progress **could be overwritten**.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Check out the following Microsoft blogs for two different walkthroughs of the backup/restore process.
trans-unit.target: Check out the following Microsoft blogs for two different walkthroughs of the backup/restore process.

trans-unit.source: Replicate Azure API Management Accounts
trans-unit.target: Replicate Azure API Management Accounts

trans-unit.source: Thank you to Gisela for her contribution to this article.
trans-unit.target: Thank you to Gisela for her contribution to this article.

trans-unit.source: Azure API Management: Backing Up and Restoring Configuration
trans-unit.target: Azure API Management: Backing Up and Restoring Configuration

trans-unit.source: The approach detailed by Stuart does not match the official guidance but it is very interesting.
trans-unit.target: The approach detailed by Stuart does not match the official guidance but it is very interesting.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
